intro: Santiria apiculata var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy santiria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
